intro: Armeriastrum laxiflorum, commonly known as the slender-flowered armeria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the carnation family, Caryophyllaceae, and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are linear and gray-green, often covered in fine hairs. Armeriastrum laxiflorum is adapted to rocky and sandy soils, making it a hardy plant suitable for xeriscaping.
